title: The Sbeiba Festival in Djanet (Illizi)
description:
The Sbeiba festival is an extraordinary cultural event celebrated annually in the oasis of Djanet, in the heart of the Tassili n'Ajjer region.

This ancient Tuareg tradition, which has been inscribed on UNESCO’s List of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity, coincides with the Islamic celebration of Ashura.

Historically, the festival marks a peace treaty signed between two rival Tuareg tribes—the El Mihan and the Azellouaz—ending a long period of conflict.

To commemorate this peace, the two communities engage in a symbolic ritual that is part-dance and part-mock battle.

description:
An original motorcycle journey to discover Algeria, through oases, desert, and breathtaking natural scenery.

An adventure steeped in majestic landscapes, ancient cities, and an authentic and vibrant culture. Crossing this vast North African country on two wheels means enjoying a unique experience, amidst fascinating roads, genuine encounters, and ever-changing panoramas.


From the Great Eastern Erg to the Great Western Erg


An itinerary designed to discover Algeria in all its diversity: from the desert regions on the edge of the Saharan Atlas to the immense expanses of sand and dunes over 100 meters high.

We will disembark in Tunis and reach the Algerian border in two stages.


Between oases and ancient cities


From El Oued, the city of a thousand domes, we will reach Ghardaia, the heart of the Pentapolis—five fortified cities in the splendid M'Zab Valley, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

We'll continue to the oasis of El Golea and Timimoun, the "Queen of the Desert," an ancient caravan center on the Trans-Saharan, famous for its red ochre hues and fiery sunsets.

From here, we'll drive through palm groves, dunes, and villages to Taghit, the pearl of the Sahara, where time seems to have stood still amidst rock carvings and Neolithic remains.

The journey continues to Aïn Sefra and Djelfa, typical Arab villages, to the splendid Biskra, the "Gateway to the Great South," an important oasis and production center for the world's finest dates.


In the footsteps of history


We'll conclude our journey north by visiting Constantine, the "city of suspension bridges," and ancient Timgad, one of Africa's most extraordinary Roman cities.


The return journey will cross Tunisia with a stop in the charming Tabarka, overlooking the Mediterranean.


A trip for everyone


This motorcycle trip in Algeria is a total immersion in the culture, history, and natural beauty of an extraordinary country.

Suitable for all types of motorcycles, even with a passenger, it is designed for those who want to discover authentic Algeria in safety, comfort, and a spirit of adventure.
itinerary: Arrive in Djanet, meet your Tuareg guide, and check into your accommodation.
Explore the palm groves of the city and visit the "Crying Cow" (La Vache qui Pleure) rock engraving
Enjoy a traditional tea ceremony under the stars
Full day 4x4 expedition into the Tassili n'Ajjer plateau.
Discover ancient rock paintings and breathtaking sandstone formations (The "Rock Forests")
Picnic lunch in a desert canyon and sunset watching from a high ridge
Head to the "Essendilene" canyon for a short hike to its hidden emerald guelta (water hole)
Drive to the massive dunes of "Admer" for sandboarding and photography
Traditional Saharan dinner and camping in the desert
Visit the local craft market in Djanet to buy Tuareg jewelry and souvenirs
Final walk through the ancient Ksar (old town)
Transfer to the airport for departure
